articles.title: Read it as `ln (-s x) y`, not `(ln -s) (x y)`
articles.summary: I could never remember the operand order for `ln -s x y`, and now I've realized why: the command supports two simultaneous parsings.`(ln -s) (x y)` — the intended reading. `-s` for "symbolic," argument order same as in `cp x y`. Fine, but I don't trust such analogies — not after `find`, `dd`, or `tar`.Also, it is weird how at birth we denote the symlink as `x y`, but later if we `ls -l y` we'll see `y -> x`.
